Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fireman \Fire"man\, n.; pl. {Firemen} (-men). 1. A man whose business is to extinguish fires in towns; a member of a fire company. [1913 Webster]
2. A man who tends the fires, as of a steam engine; a stocker. [1913 Webster]

fireman n 1: play in which children take the roles of firemen and pretend to put out a fire 2: a laborer who tends fires (as on a coal-fired train or steamship) [syn: {stoker}] 3: a pitcher who does not start the game [syn: {reliever}, {relief pitcher}] 4: a member of a fire department who tries to extinguish fires [syn: {firefighter}, {fire fighter}, {fire-eater}]
